question: A ball starts 4 m below a hoop as shown.  Someone has very conveniently left a big bold set of axes taped to the hoop (the origin is at the hoop).  The ball is thrown up through the hoop.  It rises to 2 m above the hoop and then falls back down.  On its way back through the hoop it gets stuck so that it remains in the hoop.  What is the y-component of displacementof the ball?  (from the time it is thrown until it gets stuck)
